result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Craig Nelson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel Craig Nelson in court.  
Attorney Richard Henry Hart Jr. in court for Daniel Craig Nelson.  
Attorney Erika Strebel for Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Scheduling Conference. Defense request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Daniel Craig Nelson in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status hearing. Defense has recieved all discovery. court set an additional scheduling conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 45. 
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel Craig Nelson in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for a Status Conference. State's Public Defender's office has NOT appointed counsel. Court ordered Defendant to go to the State's Public Defender's office to be evaluated. Case adjourned in Branch 45.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Status hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendants letter from the PD's office.

Defendant Daniel Craig Nelson in court.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State Public Defender's Office has not yet appointed. Case is adjourned in Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel Craig Nelson in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Attorney William Hotchkiss informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel Craig Nelson in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for arraignment.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel Craig Nelson in court in person with Attorney William Hotchkiss who appears by video.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Greenfield Officer R. Mseitif. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed; contains Cout 1 which was previously dismissed.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Arraignment scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No driving without a valid license and state required insurance.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daniel Craig Nelson in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Stephan Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  As to COUNT ONE, defense files a motion to dismiss count one for lack of probable cause. State does not object. Court grants defense's motion and dismisses count 1 without prejudice. As to COUNT TWO, court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 1/24/22 @ 2p
